ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.

Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.

name: r-clv

about.summary: Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3-2.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-clv
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/clv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/clv/clv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d8e622b67e64afdb9027a80bf332d8fd21b26e94f0cb814647f65130c84bc9df

build:
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-class
    - r-cluster
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-class
    - r-cluster

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('clv')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('clv')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=clv
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented
    in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: clv
# Title: Cluster Validation Techniques
# Version: 0.3-2.1
# Author: Lukasz Nieweglowski <wookashn@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: Lukasz Nieweglowski <wookashn@gmail.com>
# Description: Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.
# Depends: cluster, class
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# Packaged: 2013-11-11 12:42:55 UTC; ripley
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2013-11-11 13:44:41
# NeedsCompilation: yes

about.summary: Package contains most of the popular internal and external cluster validation methods ready to use for the most of the outputs produced by functions coming from package "cluster". Package contains also functions and examples of usage for cluster stability approach that might be applied to algorithms implemented in "cluster" package as well as user defined clustering algorithms.
